citation.article-title: Assignment of human-derived CDC group 1 coryneform bacteria and CDC group 1-like coryneform bacteria to the genus Actinomyces as Actinomyces neuii subsp. neuii sp. nov., subsp. nov., and Actinomyces neuii subsp. anitratus subsp. nov.

p.s: Description of Actinomyces neuii subsp. neuii sp. nov.
Actinomyces neuii subsp. neuii (neu'.ii. N. L. gen. n. neuii, of Neu, named to honor Harold Neu, an authority in antimicrobial chemotherapy and infectious diseases)
This description of morphological and physiological features is based on a study of 17 strains (references 7 and 12 and unpublished data).
Cells are gram positive and predominantly diphtheroidal, but coccobacilli may occur; the rods are mainly arranged in clusters or V or Y forms.
Cells are nonmotile and non-spore forming.
Colonies are circular, smooth, convex, opaque, more white than creamy in color, and with entire edges.
Colony sizes range from 0.5 to 1.5 mm in diameter after 48 h of incubation in 5% CO2 on sheep blood agar.
Cells are facultatively anaerobic.
Alphα-hemolysis is observed for most strains on sheep blood agar and for all strains on human blood agar.
Cells are catalase positive.

Acid is produced from D-arabitol, erythritol, D-fructose, D-galactose, 5-ketogluconate, D-glucose, glycerol, inositol, lactose, D-lyxose, maltose, D-mannitol, D-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, D-ribose, sucrose, trehalose, and D-xylose.

Some strains produce acid from N-acetylglucosamine, adonitol, L-arabitol, L-arabinose, cellobiose, dulcitol, D-fucose, L-fucose, gentiobiose, gluconate, α-methyl-D-glucoside, glycogen, inulin, α-methyl-D-mannoside, D-tagatose, and xylitol.
Acid is not produced from D-arabinose, 2-ketogluconate, L-rhamnose, salicin, D-glucitol, L-sorbose, and L-xylose.
Leucine arylamidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, α-mannosidase, and pyrazinamidase are positive.
Alkaline phosphatase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, β-glucuronidase, and β-glucosidase are negative.
Esculin, urea and gelatin are not hydrolyzed.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Straight-chain saturated fatty acids are mainly palmitic and stearic acids.
Oleic acid is the predominant unsaturated fatty acid.
DNA base composition is 55 to 58 mol% G+C (midpoint temperature).
The strains are isolated mainly from abscesses in association with mixed anaerobic flora as well as from human blood cultures.
The type strain 97/90 has been deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung für Mikroorganismen, Braunschweig, Germany, under no. DSM 8576.
Strain 97/90T has the characteristics described for the species, except that, in the variable carbohydrate fermentation tests, only gentiobiose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, and xylitol are positive.
The G+C content of strain 97/9OT's DNA is 55 mol%.
